mypackage package

Submodules

mypackage.clean_data module

This script imports the raw data, cleans it, and explorts the final dataset.

mypackage.helpers module

mypackage.helpers.sum_to_one(x, axis=1)[source]

Normalize x so that the rows or columns sum to one.

Parameters:

  • x (array_like) – Array to normalize

  • axis (int, optional) – Axis or axes along which a normalization is performed. The default, axis = 1, will row-normalize x.

Returns:

row_normalized_array – An array with the same shape as x, with the specified axis removed. The array is normalized so the rows (axis = 1) or columns (axis = 0) sum to 1.

Return type:

ndarray

Examples

>>> sum_to_one(np.array([[1, 2], [3, 4]]))
np.array([[.333333, .666667], [0.42857, 0.57142]])

mypackage.load_data module

mypackage.load_data.load_data(name='data')[source]

Function to load clean or raw data from package. Data is read in as a pandas DataFrame. :param name: :type name: string :param Options are ‘data’: :param and ‘data_raw’:

Return type:

A pandas dataframe of the requested data

mypackage.plotting module

mypackage.plotting.my_pca_plot(x, save_name, n_components=2, y=None)[source]

This function plots pairwise principal components in a grid of functions.

Parameters:

  • x (array_like) – Array to plot PCA

  • save_name (string) – The filename or path/filename to save the figure

  • n_components (int) – How many principal components to compute and plot

  • y (array_like) – Array of labels used to color the plots.

Return type:

None

mypackage.scrape_data module

This script performs the webscraping and produces the raw dataset to be cleaned.
